meta.title: Teachers & staff read to students during closure - Hockinson School District

meta.content: Teachers & staff read to students during closure
To help our students stay connected to school, HHES teachers & staff are sitting down in front of the camera to share some of their favorite stories.

link.title: Hockinson Heights Elementary School - News

form.name: aspnetForm

li.span: HSD schools are closed for the rest of the school year. Click here for more information.

div.label: Translate Page

h1.span: Teachers & staff read to students during closure

span.p: With buildings closed and teachers and classmates practicing social distancing, feeling connected to school can be quite a challenge for students, especially K-5 learners.

Over the past several weeks, to help our students at Hockinson Heights Elementary School stay connected, several teachers and staff members (and even Buzz the mascot) have sat down in front of the camera and read some of their favorite stories.
Here are just a few examples, which are being shared on social media:

link.p: You can check out all of the Story Time videos on the HHES Facebook page.

Thank you,

div.p: Our vision is to inspire all to live with strong core values, to become competent, responsible learners, independent thinkers, and positive contributors to our changing world.

h1.span: If you are unable to access any information provided on this website, please contact the Hockinson District Office by phone at (360) 448-6400. To reach us via fax, dial (360) 448-6409.
